responses: Hi there, how can I help?

patterns: I think I have a headache
responses: Hmm... try holding an ice pack over your forehead, having a good sleep or taking a break from any stress you might be having!

patterns: I ate something I shouldn't have
responses: I recommend taking antihistamines, decongestants, an anti-inflammatory agent (like corticosteroid) or an allergy shot (if you have one).
It may be wise to head to your local doctor - drink lots of water, rest a lot and eat healthy.

patterns: Pus came out of my eye
responses: You may have conjunctivitis - it's highly contagious, so wash your hands and avoid touching your eyes anymore. If your condition does not get better in 2-3 days of occurrence, visit your local doctor.

Nausea/Vomiting may be a sign of something worse - after 30-60 minutes of vomiting drink some water or milk, and only return to a regular/easy-to-digest diet after 8 hours. Alert a doctor if things get worse (e.g. vomiting a bit of blood).
